intro: Neobolusia ciliata, commonly known as the silky leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely hairy, silver-green leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal and inland regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Neobolusia ciliata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
